title: Russian attacks on energy infrastructure leaves Ukraine in dark as winter approaches

media:group.media:title: Russian attacks on energy infrastructure leaves Ukraine in dark as winter approaches
media:group.media:description:
Eight months into the war in Ukraine, Russia is pursuing a new form of escalation: drone and missile attacks on power plants and infrastructure. President Zelenskyy said 40% of the countryâ€™s energy system was destroyed by Russian shelling, and accused Russia of "energy terrorism." The attacks and blackouts have left millions in the dark as winter comes. Nick Schifrin reports.
